data.question: What are the synthesis conditions for the compounds [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] and [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3]?
data.answer: The compounds [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] and [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3] were prepared from 18C6, MSCN, and CdSO4 where M = K+ (for [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3]) and Na+ (for [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3]), respectively.

data.question: What are the crystal systems and space groups for the compounds [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] and [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3]?
data.answer: [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] crystallizes in an orthorhombic unit cell with Cmc21 space group symmetry, while [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3] crystallizes in a monoclinic unit cell with P21/n space group symmetry.

data.question: What role do the cationic host−guest complexes play in the crystal structures of [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] and [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3]?
data.answer: The cationic host−guest complexes [(18C6)K]+ and [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]2+ serve as spacers/controllers of the crystal structure and crystal symmetry, dictating the arrangement of the [Cd(SCN)3]- chains.

data.question: How do the anionic polymeric [Cd(SCN)3]- chains in [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] and [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3] contribute to their nonlinear optical (NLO) properties?
data.answer: The anionic polymeric [Cd(SCN)3]- chains form isolated one-dimensional zig-zag chains with extended π-conjugation systems within the polymeric chain, which, coupled with the high polarizabilities of both the metal and the ligand, give rise to NLO effects.

data.question: True or False: The compound [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] exhibits nonlinear optical effects (NLO) while [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3] does not.
True or False: The crystal structure of [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] is centrosymmetric.
What is the significance of the cationic host−guest complexes in the design of IPOS systems as exemplified by [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] and [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3]?
data.answer: The cationic host−guest complexes are crucial for the design of IPOS systems as they allow for concomitant but separate molecular and crystal engineering, enabling the optimization of physical properties such as nonlinear optical (NLO) effects.

data.question: True or False: The compounds [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] and [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3] are examples of molecular host−guest complexes.
What is the role of the trans influence in the coordination of SCN- ligands to Cd2+ ions in the compounds [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] and [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3]?
data.answer: The trans influence dictates that the sulfur atoms are trans to the nitrogen atoms in the coordination sphere of Cd2+ ions, leading to an unsymmetrical Cd coordination and hence highly asymmetrical electronic distribution about the Cd atoms, which is important for their NLO properties.

data.question: True or False: The crystal structures of [(18C6)K][Cd(SCN)3] and [(18C6)2Na2(H2O)2]1/2[Cd(SCN)3] can be described as crystal host−guest clathrates.
